A suspension of H4tmdta (3.06 g, 0.01 mol) in 20 mL of water was heated with stirring to 70 °C. After addition of a first portion of Li2CO3 (0.01 mol, 0.74 g), a clear solution resulted. Then 3.66 g (0.01 mol) of Ni(ClO4)2·6H2O was added under stirring. A second portion of Li2CO3 (0.01 mol, 0.74 g) was added (one has to be careful during both additions of Li2CO3 because of the very intensive development of CO2!), and heating was continued for 1 h. The resulting blue solution was placed in the refrigerator. After a period of several days, greenish-blue crystals were formed. These were collected by suction filtration and washed with cold water and ethanol. Recrystallization was carried out from a water–ethanol mixture. Yield: 3.7 g (80%). Anal. Calcd for C11H24Li2N2NiO13 (464.9): C, 33.58; H, 7.81; N, 6.03. Found: C, 33.50; H, 7.86; N, 6.00. Single crystals suitable for X-ray structure determination were prepared in the following way: A concentrated aqueous solution of 1 was gently layered with the 3-fold volume of ethanol in a large reagent glass. Crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction formed after several days. These were removed by hand picking.

{C(NH<sub>2</sub>)<sub>3</sub>}<sub>2</sub>[Ni(tmdta)]·6H<sub>2</sub>O (<bold>1b</bold>)

A suspension of H4tmdta (3.06 g, 0.01 mol) in 30 mL of water was heated with stirring to 70 °C. A 2.9 g amount (0.01 mol) of [Ni(H2O)6]·2NO3 was added to this solution, which gave in a short moment a turquoise blue solution. After stirring for further 10 min at 70 °C, the solution was cooled to room temperature. Then, a 3.6 g amount of {C(NH2)3}CO3 (0.02 mol) was gently added to the solution in portions, which resulted in a color change to clear deep blue. Standing of the clear solution at room temperature over 2 days led to the separation of clear, deep blue crystals, which were separated by filtration. Yield: 5.0 g (85%). Anal. Calcd for C13H38NiN8O14 (589.2): C, 26.50; H, 6.50; N, 19.02. Found: C, 26.48; H, 6.63; N, 18.89. Single crystals suitable for X-ray structure determination were prepared in the following way: A concentrated aqueous solution of 1b was set aside in a Petri dish. Crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction formed after 1 week.

[Ni(H<sub>2</sub>O)<sub>6</sub>][Ni(tmdta)]·2H<sub>2</sub>O (<bold>2a</bold>)

This solid formed accidently during a trial to prepare 1b where only one-half of the amount of {C(NH2)3}CO3 was added. Therefore, the procedure to make 2a is completely identical to that of 1b except that 1.8 g (0.01 mol) of {C(NH2)3}CO3 was added to a solution containing H4tmdta (3.06 g, 0.01 mol) and 2.9 g (0.01 mol) of [Ni(H2O)6]·2NO3 in 30 mL of water. Crystals formed after 1 week of standing of this solution, had a regular shape, and were suitable for structural analysis. Yield: 4.5 g (80%). Anal. Calcd for C11H30N2Ni2O16 (563.8): C, 23.44; H, 5.36; N, 4.97. Found: C, 23.36; H, 5.42; N, 4.93.

[Mg(H<sub>2</sub>O)<sub>6</sub>][Ni(tmdta)]·2H<sub>2</sub>O (<bold>2b</bold>)

A suspension of H4tmdta (3.06 g, 0.01 mol) in 20 mL of water was heated with stirring to 70 °C. After addition of a first portion of MgCO3·3H2O (0.01 mol, 1.38 g), a clear solution resulted. Subsequently, 3.66 g (0.01 mol) of Ni(ClO4)2·6H2O was added under stirring. A second portion of MgCO3·3H2O (0.01 mol, 1.38 g) was added. After carbon dioxide formation ceased, a deep blue solution resulted. This was layered with a solution of ethanol until the first turbidity appears and placed then in a refrigerator. A crystalline solid formed after 3 days, which was collected by vacuum filtration. Yield: 4.7 g (89%). Anal. Calcd for C11H30MgN2NiO16 (529.4): C, 24.96; H, 5.71; N, 5.29. Found: C, 24.89; H, 5.77; N, 5.25.

[Mg(H2O)6][Ni(tmdta)]⋅2H2O (2b)

A suspension of H4tmdta (3.06 g, 0.01 mol) in 20 mL of water was heated with stirring to 70 °C. After addition of a first portion of MgCO3⋅3H2O (0.01 mol, 1.38 g), a clear solution resulted. Subsequently, 3.66 g (0.01 mol) of Ni(ClO4)2⋅6H2O was added under stirring. A second portion of MgCO3⋅3H2O (0.01 mol, 1.38 g) was added. After carbon dioxide formation ceased, a deep blue solution resulted. This was layered with a solution of ethanol until the first turbidity appears and placed then in a refrigerator. A crystalline solid formed after 3 days, which was collected by vacuum filtration. Yield: 4.7 g (89%). Anal. Calcd for C11H30MgN2NiO16 (529.4): C, 24.96; H, 5.71; N, 5.29. Found: C, 24.89; H, 5.77; N, 5.25.
